info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 11:01PM EDT until May 15 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Virginia, including the following counties, Frederick and Shenandoah.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Strasburg... Woodstock... Mount Jackson... Star Tannery... Edinburg... Maurertown... Toms Brook... Alonzaville... Fishers Hill... Harmony... Seven Fountains... Dilbeck... Saint Davids Church... Gravel Springs... Clary... Hawkinstown... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Fromans Road near Cedar Creek, Wardensville Grade near Furnace Run, Wren Lane and Oranda Road and Fort Valley Road at Passage Creek. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT THURSDAY
